message:
The negotiations for a ceasefire deal with Hamas

The Lebanese al-Mayadeen channel, which is identified with the axis of resistance, from its sources:

Hamas submitted changes to the Israeli document in a way that does not touch the essential issues.

Hamas stuck to its position regarding the establishment of a permanent ceasefire, the withdrawal of forces from the Strip and the return of the displaced.

Hamas insisted on withdrawing from the Philadelphia axis and the Rafah crossing.

Hamas opposes an Israeli veto for the names of Palestinian prisoners serving life sentences in a release deal.

Hamas has shown flexibility regarding the continuation of negotiations until a permanent ceasefire is reached.
event_breakdown: Ceasefire negotiations between Israel and Hamas on establishing a permanent ceasefire in the Gaza Strip, reported in Arabic on al-Mayadeen channel.

message:
Daraa, southern Syria: Abu Hazem presents to the cameras the invention that allows him to travel three days on a motorcycle on one liter of fuel.
This is how it works according to him: fuel in one plastic container, water in a second plastic container. The burning of the fuel creates air pressure that is pushed into the water tank and from there to the carburetor and this is how fuel savings are achieved.... Don't try it at home (:
event_breakdown: Abu Hazem, a Syrian man from Daraa, southern Syria, claims to have invented a way to travel three days on a motorcycle with a single liter of fuel. This invention is based on the use of air pressure to push water into the carburetor, which he claims results in fuel savings. However, it is important to note that this invention has not been independently verified and its safety and effectiveness are not yet known.

At the end of the ceremony, his coffin went south to Haddatha where he will be buried at 18:00.

message:
Hezbollah announces a death in its ranks:

Hadi Shareem

He was killed in the Israeli attack this morning in Hula.

Number 363.
event_breakdown: Lebanese Hezbollah member Hadi Shareem was killed in the Israeli attack this morning in Hula. He was a member of Hezbollah's special forces and was killed along with three other militants. This is the fifth attack by Israel in a week on Hezbollah targets in Lebanon.

Lebanese channels report one person killed and several others wounded in an IDF attack on a building in the al-Maaqab neighborhood in the village of Hula in southern Lebanon.

The attack happened about three hours ago.

message:
Starting a couple of hours ago, Hezbollah launched rockets and anti-tank missiles towards Israel in response to the killing of Hajj Abu Ne'ema, commander of Hezbollah's Aziz unit, yesterday.

At 14:00 (local time), there is a ceremony in the Dahiyeh in Beirut and at 18:00 (local time), a funeral in Haddatha in southern Lebanon.

Al-Jazeera, quoting a source from Hezbollah: As part of the response to the killing of Mahmoud Nasser (Hajj Abu Ne'ema), we launched 20 anti-tank missiles and 200 rockets towards Israeli targets in the Galilee and the Golan Heights.

Hezbollah in an official statement:
We completed our response to the assassination in Tyre by firing more than 200 rockets, missiles and drones at the following targets:

Command Center of Brigade 91,
Command Center of Division 7,
Northern Command Headquarters (Dado Base),
Military Intelligence Base in Meishar,
Command Center of Hermon Brigade,
Command Center of Brigade 146,
Golani Command Center in Sharaga.

Note the use of the word "completed," indicating that at this stage, Hezbollah may have concluded its response to the assassination, and is waiting to see how Israel will respond.
event_breakdown: Hezbollah fires rockets and anti-tank missiles at Israeli targets in the Galilee and the Golan Heights, in response to the killing of Mahmoud Nasser (Hajj Abu Ne'ema). The attack targets Israel's Northern Command Headquarters, the Hermon Brigade, and Hermon Brigade.

message:
Hezbollah published more details about Hajj Abu Nee'ma yesterday:
Born in 1965
Joined Hezbollah in 1986 at the age of 21
Participated in the Second Lebanon War
Fought in Iraq and Syria against the "terrorist organizations" from 2011 to 2016
In 2015 he was injured in the war (Syria/Iraq)
Appointed commander of the Aziz unit in 2016 after his predecessor was killed
Won awards for his activities from Hezbollah Secretary General Hassan Nasrallah

##
Lebanese sources add that he survived several assassination attempts by Israel.

According to media outlets associated with the Shiite axis, Abu Nee'ma oversaw the launch of missiles that photographed the target (as you can see in the videos published by Hezbollah from time to time).
These sources also stated that he oversaw the two attacks on the Israeli observation balloon.
Abu Nee'ma together with his counterpart Taleb Abdullah, who was killed a few weeks ago, supervised the first attack against the IDF air control unit in Miron.
event_breakdown:
The event reports are located under the section "appoints commander of the Aziz unit", and refer to an event at the time when Hajj Abu Nee'ma was "appointed" in 2016.
Therefore, according to the given premise, it appears that among the reported events in the current text, there are no current event reports that would be suitable for mapping.

message:
During the ceremony held today in Dahiyeh of Beirut in honor of Muhammad Nasser, the commander of the Aziz unit, we see at 00:17 a video of a senior Hezbollah commander with a red beret on his head.

This is the same commander who was seen in May 2023 (I will immediately attach the video below👇) receiving the personal weapon of Imad Mughniyeh (Hezbollah Chief of Staff who was killed in Syria in 2008) from the hands of Hashim Safi Al Din, number 2 in Hezbollah.

There are opinions that this is Haytham Ali Tabatbai, who is considered the commander of the Radwan force, the elite force of Hezbollah, on whose head the Americans placed a reward of 5 million dollars.
event_breakdown: During the ceremony held today in Dahiyeh of Beirut in honor of Muhammad Nasser, the commander of the Aziz unit, we see at 00:17 a video of a senior Hezbollah commander with a red beret on his head. This is the same commander who was seen in May 2023 receiving the personal weapon of Imad Mughniyeh from the hands of Hashim Safi Al Din, who is the 2nd in command of Hezbollah. This red beret commander could be Haytham Ali Tabatbai, who is considered the commander of the Radwan force, the elite force of Hezbollah. The US has placed a $5 million bounty on Tabatbai's head.

message:
Fatah's al-Aqsa Martyrs Brigade in Jenin in a statement:

Nadal el-Amer (who was killed yesterday in an undercover operation in Jenin) was one of the founders of Fatah's al-Aqsa Martyrs Battalions in Jenin.

He carried out several shooting attacks against IDF checkpoints.

He had a central role in the attack in which IEDs were fired at IDF APCs in Jenin on June 27 (an IDF officer was killed and 17 soldiers were injured in this attack).

##
I would like to point out that the military wing of the Islamic Jihad accepted responsibility for that attack. Cooperation in the West Bank between Fatah's Al-Aqsa Martyrs Battalions and the Islamic Jihad's military arm in attacks against Israeli targets is recognized.
event_breakdown:
Event 1: Al-Aqsa Martyrs Brigade members shot dead by IDF undercover forces in Jenin
Event 2: Al-Aqsa Martyrs Brigade members involved in attack on IDF forces, including shooting and IED attacks
Event 3: Al-Aqsa Martyrs Brigade members involved in attack that killed IDF officer and injured 17 soldiers

message: Gazan journalists: These are the water pipes through which the IDF attempted to pump seawater into Hamas tunnels at the beginning of the war.
event_breakdown:
IDF Attempts to Pump Seawater into Hamas Tunnels
During the 2021 Israel-Gaza Conflict, the IDF attempted to pump seawater into Hamas tunnels in an effort to destroy them. The attempt was made using large water pipes and other infrastructure, but it was ultimately unsuccessful.

message:
Hamas and Islamic Jihad supporters on social media are mocking a senior officer in the Palestinian Authority police who was injured in the explosion of a device at the police station in Nablus, after a photo of him was published.

These supporters are celebrating the misfortune of the Palestinian police officers who tried to save the "occupying soldiers" from "resistance explosives" and thus "received" the fate that was intended for Israelis.
